alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 6:40PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HIGH RIVER LEVELS AND NEAR RECORD WARM TEMPERATURES TO PERSIST INTO MID-NEXT WEEK... Near persistent warm temperatures in higher elevations will continue to cause snow and ice melt into rivers of Upper Lynn Canal including the Taiya, the Skagway, and the Klehini Rivers. This has caused high water levels and near bankfull conditions in rivers and streams throughout Upper Lynn Canal. There are indications that very warm temperatures in the 80s will move back into the region late this weekend into early next week. Daily high temperature records will likely fall in some areas. This will raise water levels even more from snow and ice melt. To minimize impacts of the heat, locate fans for cooling; wear light-colored and loose fitting clothes; drink plenty of fluids, apply sun protection, and take breaks if you must be outdoors for extended periods; do not leave young children and pets unattended in closed vehicles; and plan to check on the elderly, those who are home-bound, and other loved ones and neighbors who could be more vulnerable. Check for updates into the weekend. For Taiya River near Skagway: At 4:00pm the stage was 15.76 feet. Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 16.2 feet is expected around 10:00pm Saturday. Impacts: At 16.1 feet: Portions of the Chilkoot Trail begins to inundate with water.
